message.content:
Step 1: Identify the Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) from the income statement.
• COGS = 6,720,000.00

Step 2: Determine the average inventory.
• From the balance sheet:
 – Initial Inventory = 0.00 (at 2023-12-31)
 – Ending Inventory = 4,530,000.00 (at 2024-01-28)
• Average Inventory = (0.00 + 4,530,000.00) / 2 = 2,265,000.00

Step 3: Calculate the Inventory Turnover Ratio.
• Inventory Turnover Ratio = COGS / Average Inventory = 6,720,000.00 / 2,265,000.00 ≈ 2.97

Thus, the Inventory Turnover Ratio is approximately 2.97.

{
  "solution": {"Inventory Turnover Ratio": "2.97"}
}
